properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Lakes Entrance beach.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity.
  • The whale carcass is located at the east of Drew's Jetty. 
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
Avoid the area. Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:

  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.
Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
Impacts in your area:
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is monitoring for shark sightings and providing advice to relevant authorities. 
This message was issued by VFA.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 03:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - DANGEROUS ANIMAL - Avoid the Area
Incident Location: Lakes Entrance
Issue Date: Thursday 22 February 2024, 03:04 pm
Next Update: Thursday 29 February 2024, 03:10 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/32948/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Lakes Entrance beach.

- Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity.
- The whale carcass is located at the east of Drew's Jetty. 
- A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
- While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area. 


Avoid the area. Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Dereel.

  • There was a grassfire that started at Kleins Rd, Dereel that is under control.
  • This grassfire travelled in a south then easterly direction towards the Colac-Ballarat Road.
  • This Advice message has been reduced based on the containment of the fire.
  • If conditions are suitable, there may an increase in smoke due to operational activity today. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 12:36 am on Thursday 29 February 2024.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • Review your fire survival plan.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following roads may be impacted by smoke overnight:
  • Colac-Ballarat Road has been reopened with reduced speed limits through the warning area.
  • Ferrers Road.
Road closures:
  • Swamp Road remains closed due to hazarous trees.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
The Bannockburn Relief Centre is closed.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

ADVICE - GRASS FIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Kleins Rd, Dereel
Issue Date: Thursday 29 February 2024, 04:52 am
Next Update: Thursday 29 February 2024, 11:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33224/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Dereel.

- There was a grassfire that started at Kleins Rd, Dereel that is under control.
- This grassfire travelled in a south then easterly direction towards the Colac-Ballarat Road. 
- This Advice message has been reduced based on the containment of the fire. 
- If conditions are suitable, there may an increase in smoke due to operational activity today.  
- This Advice message replaces the Advice issued at 12:36 am on Thursday 29 February 2024.


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Dereel.

  • There was a grassfire that started at Kleins Rd, Dereel that is under control.
  • The grassfire travelled in a south then easterly direction towards the Colac-Ballarat Road. 
  • Firefighters have been able to contain the spread of the fire, but this can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • This Watch and Act has been reduced based on the containment of the fire.
  • If conditions are suitable, there may an increase in smoke due to operational activity today. 
  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 12:36am on Thursday 29 February 2024.
Staying close to a building where you can shelter is the safest option, as conditions can change suddenly.

Continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Monitor changes, including increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility that indicates the situation is changing. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.

If the situation changes you will need to leave quickly. Plan to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
  • Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.

The Bannockburn Relief Centre is closed.
Impacts in your area:
  • The following roads may be impacted by smoke:
  • Colac-Ballarat Road has been reopened with reduced speed limits through the warning area. 
  • Ferrers Road.
Road closures:
  • Swamp Road remains closed due to hazarous trees. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 11:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Raglan, Buangor East, Eurambeen, Bayindeen, Buangor, Middle Creek
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bayindeen, Buangor, Middle Creek, Raglan, Buangor East, Eurambeen.

  •  There is a bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky-Road that is not yet under control and is still active in this area.
  •  Aircraft, heavy machinery, and firefighters will be working in the area.

Dangerous fire conditions are predicted for today Wednesday 28 February.

View an update including a map of the area of locations that could be impacted by fire, spot fires and ember attack on Wednesday.


Anyone still in these areas should leave early this morning (Wednesday 28 February).

 

Go to the homes of family or friends outside the warning areas.  

 

What you should do: 

If you have not already left: 

  • Leave early this morning (Wednesday 28 February).
  • Do not wait until the bushfire spreads closer before moving to a safer location.
  • The fire could grow significantly and may become uncontrollable.
  • If you do not leave this morning, you may become isolated and your route to safer locations may be blocked.
  • Road closures may occur, including roads that have recently been reopened.
  • Do not rely on firefighting crews to protect you and your property. 

 

If you have already left: 

  • Do not return to your home until it is safe to do so. 

Relief centres are open at:     

- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.     

- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

- Selkirks Stadium, 989 Norman Street, Ballarat.  Domestic pets are welcome provided they remain outside of the centre. Please bring a suitable carrier/restraint. Caravans are also allowed. 

 

Let others know that you are safe :

·         Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.

·         Use the Red Cross website to let your family and friends know you are safe - Red Cross Register, Find Unite  

·         Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

Impacts in your area:

The following roads are closed: 

·         Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre  

·         Beaufort-Lexton Road   

·         Lexton Ararat Road  

·         Main Lead Road at King Street, Beaufort to Raglan  

·         Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 

·         Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst  

·         Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute  

·         Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 

·         Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway  

·         Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor  

·         Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo,  

·         Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.



Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

 

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

·         The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort will be closed today.  

·         Community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns.  

·         The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.  



Water and power outages: 

·         Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure. Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.  

 

Air Quality

EPA have put air quality monitors at Amphitheatre and Beaufort.

Check EPA website for current readings and advice.



The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

 

State Forest Closures

·         Mount Cole State Forest

·         Ben Major State Forest

·         Mt Lonarch State Forest

·         Fortes Bush State Forest

·         Musical Gully State Forest

·         Camphill State Forest.



Parks Victoria closures:

·         Mount Buangor State Park (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)

·         Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) 

·         Langi-Ghiran State Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 09:20 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

  • Aircraft, heavy machinery, and firefighters will be working in the area.
    • Dangerous fire conditions are predicted for today Wednesday 28 February. View an update including a map of the area of locations that could be impacted by fire, spot fires and ember attack on Wednesday. Anyone still in these areas should leave early this morning (Wednesday 28 February). Go to the homes of family or friends outside the warning areas.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Main Lead, Waterloo. 

  • Despite recent light rain in the area, the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky Road is not yet under control and is still active with fire conditions still dangerous.  
  • It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning area.
  • Firefighters continue to work on the fires edge. 
  • Aircraft and heavy machinery will be working in the area.
It is Not Safe to Return.


What you should do:

If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. 
Relief centres are open at:
  • Ararat Football Ground, Alexandra Oval, Waratah Street, Ararat.
  • Princes Park, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
  • Selkirks Stadium, 989 Norman Street, Ballarat.  Domestic pets are welcome provided they remain outside of the centre. Please bring a suitable carrier/restraint. Caravans are also allowed. 

Let others know that you are safe :

·       Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.

·       Use the Red Cross website to let your family and friends know you are safe - Red Cross Register, Find Unite  

·       Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

Impacts in your area:

The following roads are closed:
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road 
  • Lexton Ararat Road 
  • Main Lead Road at King Street Beaufort to Raglan 
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst 
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute 
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway 
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor 
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo, 
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.   

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

·       The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort continues to remain closed. It will reopen when conditions ease. Please check if the centre is open before attending. 

·       Community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns.  

·       The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.   


Water and power outages:

·       Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure. Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.  


Air Quality

  • Check EPA AirWatch for the current air quality in your area. For information on smoke impacts refer to smoke and your health.
The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

State Forest closures:
  • Mount Cole State Forest 
  • Ben Major State Forest 
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest 
  • Fortes Bush State Forest 
  • Musical Gully State Forest 
  • Camphill State Forest 
Parks Vic Closures
  • Mount Buangor State Park (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria) 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) Community 
  • Langi-Ghiran State Park 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 
The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 12:30 pm or as the situation changes. 
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Not Safe to Return Incident Location: Bayindeen Rocky Road Issue Date: Wednesday 28 February 2024, 09:55 pm Next Update: Thursday 29 February 2024, 12:30 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33212/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for Main Lead, Waterloo. - Despite recent light rain in the area, the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky Road is not yet under control and is still active with fire conditions still dangerous. - It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning area. - Firefighters continue to work on the fires edge. - Aircraft and heavy machinery will be working in the area. It is Not Safe to Return. What you should do: If you have already left: - Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. Relief centres are open at: - Ararat Football Ground, Alexandra Oval, Waratah Street, Ararat. - Princes Park, 40 Park Road, Maryborough. - Selkirks Stadium, 989 Norman Street, Ballarat. Domestic pets are welcome provided they remain outside of the centre. Please bring a suitable carrier/restraint. Caravans are also allowed. Let others know that you are safe : · Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe. · Use the Red Cross website to let your family and friends know you are safe - Red Cross Register, Find Unite · Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Pomonal and surrounding communities.  

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park, Bellfield that is under control.
  • Fire crews remain in the area monitoring conditions.
  • Take extra precautions during high winds. 
  • Areas of the Grampians National Park near the Bellfield fire remain closed.  Check parks.vic.gov.au for more information.
  • Access to Pomonal is restricted to local residents, emergency services and essential services. Check the VicTraffic website (VicTraffic) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required. 
Plan for the catastrophic fire danger day predicted for Wednesday. 
Enact your fire plan. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 01/03/2024 07:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for water quality at Lake Bolac. 
  • High levels of blue-green algae have been detected in the lake. 
  • The algal bloom is expected to remain until there is significant rainfall to flush the lake or cooler conditions slow the algae. 
  • Regular testing is being conducted to identify new outbreaks or changes that might indicate improved water quality. 
  • This notification will be reviewed weekly and updated as the situation changes.
Warning signs have been installed at the lake.

You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe. 
What you should do:
  • Visit Parks Victoria website (https://www.parks.vic.gov.au/places-to-see/parks/lake-bolac-highway-park) for more information. 
  • Observe information signs posted at the lake.
Protect your health:
  • Direct contact with water affected by blue green algae can cause skin irritation, sore eyes, ears and nose. If swallowed it can cause cramps, nausea and vomiting. 
  • If you do come into contact with affected water, wash your skin immediately in clean cool water. 
  • Boiling affected water does not make it safe to drink. Boiling water bursts the blue green algae cells and releases toxins into the water making it more likely that you will experience symptoms. 
  • If you are experiencing any health issues after contact with affected water seek medical advice from your local doctor or Nurse-On-Call on 1300 60 60 24.
Protect your pets:
  • Pet owners should prevent pets from drinking or having direct contact with contaminated water. 
Agriculture information: 
  • Irrigation water contaminated with blue-green algae should not be spray irrigated on vegetables and fruit, or come in contact with plants being grown for food during processing and packing. 
  • Fruit and vegetables grown in the affected areas are safe to consume if farmers follow recommendations regarding blue-green algae
Impacts in your area:
  • The water is  green as a result of the algae bloom.
Boating and fishing:
  • Boating and fishing is still allowed in these areas, however care needs to be taken.
  • Fish caught from affected areas should be rinsed and cleaned thoroughly in fresh water, and internal organs removed from the fish and discarded before eating. 
  • Do not eat mussels, crayfish or yabbies caught from the affected area. 
This message was issued by Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action.

The next update is expected by 31/03/2024 05:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Information about blue green algae:
  • For information on blue green algae visit: www2.health.vic.gov.au/public-health/water/blue-green-algae-cyanobac teria.
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter.
  • Tune into ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:

Issue Date: Tuesday 23 January 2024, 03:14 pm
Next Update: Sunday 31 March 2024, 05:20 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/32563/moreinfo

This message is being issued for water quality at Lake Bolac. 
- High levels of blue-green algae have been detected in the lake. 
- The algal bloom is expected to remain until there is significant rainfall to flush the lake or cooler conditions slow the algae. 
- Regular testing is being conducted to identify new outbreaks or changes that might indicate improved water quality. 
- This notification will be reviewed weekly and updated as the situation changes. 



Warning signs have been installed at the lake. 
You should avoid direct contact with affected water in Lake Bolac.

Do not swim in affected areas or use water for cooking, drinking, washing or showering. Boiling the water will not make it safe.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Glenpatrick, Nowhere Creek, Eversley, Glenlofty, Percydale, Warrenmang
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Eversley, Glenlofty, Glenpatrick, Nowhere Creek, Percydale, Warrenmang.

  • There is a bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky-Road that is not yet under control and is still active in this area.  
  • Aircraft, heavy machinery, and firefighters will be working in the area.
Dangerous fire conditions are predicted for tomorrow Wednesday 28 February.

 View an update including a map of the area of locations that could be impacted by fire, spot fires and ember attack on Wednesday.

Anyone still in these areas should leave early this morning (Wednesday 28 February).


Go to the homes of family or friends outside the warning areas.  
What you should do: 
If you have not already left: 
  • Leave early this morning (Wednesday 28 February). 
  • Do not wait until the bushfire spreads closer before moving to a safer location.
  • The fire could grow significantly and may become uncontrollable. 
  • If you do not leave this morning, you may become isolated and your route to safer locations may be blocked. 
  • Road closures may occur, including roads that have recently been reopened. 
  • Do not rely on firefighting crews to protect you and your property.

If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until it is safe to do so. 

Relief centres are open at:     

- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.     

- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

- Selkirks Stadium, 989 Norman Street, Ballarat.  Domestic pets are welcome provided they remain outside of the centre. Please bring a suitable carrier/restraint. Caravans are also allowed. 

 

Let others know that you are safe :

·         Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.

·         Use the Red Cross website to let your family and friends know you are safe - Red Cross Register, Find Unite  

·         Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

Impacts in your area: 

  • The following roads are closed: 
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre  
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road   
  • Lexton Ararat Road  
  • Main Lead Road at King Street, Beaufort to Raglan  
  • Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst  
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute  
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway  
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor  
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo,  
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

·         The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort will be closed today.  

·         Community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns.  

·         The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice.  


Water and power outages : 

·         Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure. Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.  

 

Air Quality

EPA have put air quality monitors at Amphitheatre and Beaufort.

Check EPA website for current readings and advice.


The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

State Forest Closures
  • Mount Cole State Forest
  • Ben Major State Forest
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest
  • Fortes Bush State Forest
  • Musical Gully State Forest
  • Camphill State Forest.
Parks Victoria closures:
  • Mount Buangor State Park  
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) 
  • Langi-Ghiran State Park 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 09:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Dangerous fire conditions are predicted for tomorrow Wednesday 28 February. View an update including a map of the area of locations that could be impacted by fire, spot fires and ember attack on Wednesday. Anyone still in these areas should leave early this morning (Wednesday 28 February). Go to the homes of family or friends outside the warning areas.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Raglan
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Raglan.  

  • Despite recent light rain in the area, the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky Road is not yet under control and is still active.
  • It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning area.
  • Firefighters continue to work on the fires edge. 
  • Aircraft and heavy machinery will be working in the area. 
It is Not Safe to Return.



What you should do:

If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. 

Relief centres are open at:      
  • Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.
  • Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.
  • Selkirks Stadium, 989 Norman Street, Ballarat. Domestic pets are welcome provided they remain outside of the centre. Please bring a suitable carrier/restraint.  Caravans are also allowed.
Let others know that you are safe
  • Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Use the Red Cross website to let your family and friends know you are safe - Red Cross Register, Find Unite
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Impacts in your area:

The following roads are closed: 
  • Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre 
  • Beaufort-Lexton Road Lexton 
  • Ararat Road Main Lead Road at King Street 
  • Beaufort to Raglan Eurambeen-Raglan Road, 
  • Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 
  • Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst 
  • Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute 
  • Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 
  • Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway 
  • Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor 
  • Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo, 
  • Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.  

Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

·       The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street Beaufort continues to remain closed.  Will reopen when conditions ease. Please check if the centre is open before attending.

·       Community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns.  

·       The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice. 

  

Water and power outages

·       Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure. Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.

       

Air Quality

  •  Check EPA AirWatch for the current air quality in your area. For information on smoke impacts refer to smoke and your health.


The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

State Forest Closures
  • Mount Cole State Forest 
  • Ben Major State Forest
  • Mt Lonarch State Forest 
  • Fortes Bush State Forest 
  • Musical Gully State Forest 
  • Camphill State Forest  

Parks Victoria closures: 
  • Mount Buangor State Park (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)- 
  • Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) 
  • Langi-Ghiran State Park
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 
The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 12:00 pm or as the situation changes. 
Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Not Safe to Return Incident Location: Bayindeen-Rocky Road Issue Date: Wednesday 28 February 2024, 09:39 pm Next Update: Thursday 29 February 2024, 12:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/33211/moreinfo This Watch and Act message is being issued for Amphitheatre, Bayindeen, Ben Nevis, Chute, Elmhurst, Eversley, Glenlogie, Mount Cole, Mount Lonarch, Raglan. - Despite recent light rain in the area, the bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky Road is not yet under control and is still active. - It is Not Safe to Return to the Warning area. - Firefighters continue to work on the fires edge. - Aircraft and heavy machinery will be working in the area. It is Not Safe to Return. What you should do: If you have already left: - Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. Relief centres are open at: - Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat. - Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough. - Selkirks Stadium, 989 Norman Street, Ballarat. Domestic pets are welcome provided they remain outside of the centre. Please bring a suitable carrier/restraint. Caravans are also allowed. Let others know that you are safe - Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe. - Use the Red Cross website to let your family and friends know you are safe - Red Cross Register, Find Unite - Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Langi Kal Kal, Trawalla, Beaufort, Brewster, Ercildoune, Glenbrae, Waterloo
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Beaufort, Brewster, Ercildoune, Glenbrae, Langi Kal Kal, Trawalla, Waterloo.

  •  There is a bushfire at Bayindeen-Rocky-Road that is not yet under control and is still active in this area.
  • Strong westerly winds have the potential to make fire fighting difficult.

·         Aircraft, heavy machinery, and firefighters will be working in the area.



Dangerous fire conditions are predicted into the evening of Wednesday 28 February.

 

Anyone still in these areas should leave now.

 

Go to the homes of family or friends outside the warning areas.  

What you should do: 

If you have not already left:

  •  Leave now (Wednesday 28 February).
  •  Do not wait until the bushfire spreads closer before moving to a safer location.
  • The fire could grow significantly and may become uncontrollable.
  • If you do not leave, you may become isolated and your route to safer locations may be blocked. 
  • Road closures may occur, including roads that have recently been reopened.
  • Do not rely on firefighting crews to protect you and your property.       

If you have already left: 

  • Do not return to your home until it is safe to do so.

Relief centres are open at:     

- Alexandra Oval, Waratah Avenue, Ararat.     

- Princes Park Reserve, 40 Park Road, Maryborough.

- Selkirks Stadium, 989 Norman Street, Ballarat.  Domestic pets are welcome provided they remain outside of the centre. Please bring a suitable carrier/restraint.  Caravans are also allowed.

 

Let others know that you are safe.

·         Register at a relief centre so that your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.

·         Use the Red Cross website to let your family and friends know you are safe - Red Cross Register, Find Unite  

·         Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.

Impacts in your area: 

The following roads are closed: 

·         Pyrenees Highway from Ararat to Amphitheatre  

·         Beaufort-Lexton Road   

·         Lexton Ararat Road  

·         Main Lead Road at King Street, Beaufort to Raglan  

·         Eurambeen-Raglan Road, Eurambeen from Western Highway to Raglan 

·         Raglan-Elmhurst Road from Raglan to Elmhurst  

·         Amphitheatre Road from Amphitheatre to Chute  

·         Mount Cole Road from Warrak to Mt Cole 

·         Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway  

·         Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor  

·         Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo,  

·         Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.


Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.


Beaufort Urgent Care Centre

·         The Beaufort Urgent Care Centre at 28 Havelock Street will be closed Wednesday 28 February.

·         Community members should contact Triple Zero (000) for emergency medical care or call nurse on call 1300 60 60 24 for minor health concerns.  

·         The Beaufort nursing home remains closed, and residents remain relocated at Grampians Health Ballarat until further notice. 


Water and power outages:  

·      Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure.  

  • Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.  

 

Air Quality

Check EPA AirWatch for the current air quality in your area. For information on smoke impacts refer to smoke and your health.

 

The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.


State Forest Closures

·         Mount Cole State Forest

·         Ben Major State Forest

·         Mt Lonarch State Forest

·         Fortes Bush State Forest

·         Musical Gully State Forest

·         Camphill State Forest.


Parks Victoria closures:

·         Mount Buangor State Park 

·         Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) 

·         Langi-Ghiran State Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 08:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

This Advice message is being issued for Beaufort, Brewster, Ercildoune, Glenbrae, Langi Kal Kal, Trawalla, Waterloo.

- Strong westerly winds have the potential to make fire fighting difficult.
  ·         Aircraft, heavy machinery, and firefighters will be working in the area.
  
 <!--[endif]-->  Dangerous fire conditions are predicted into the evening of Wednesday 28 February.   

Anyone still in these areas should leave now.     Go to the homes of family or friends outside the warning areas.

properties.location: Avoca, Green Hill Creek, Lexton, Rosyth, Lamplough
properties.webBody:

·         Lexton Ararat Road  

·         Main Lead Road at King Street, Beaufort to Raglan

·         Buangor-Ben Nevis Road from Warrak to Western Highway  

·         Ferntree Gully Road from Western Highway to Mt Buangor  

·         Jones Road, from Black Bottom Road to Waterloo,  

·         Trawalla Waterloo Road, between Beaufort-Lexton Road to Racecourse Road.

·         Bushfires and power outages can affect the water supply and pressure. Residents should not rely on town water as part of their fire plans.

EPA have put air quality monitors at Amphitheatre and Beaufort.

Check EPA website for current readings and advice.



The following public land areas have been affected by the Bayindeen- Rocky Road Fire.

 

State Forest Closures

·         Mount Cole State Forest

·         Ben Major State Forest

·         Mt Lonarch State Forest

·         Fortes Bush State Forest

·         Musical Gully State Forest

·         Camphill State Forest.



Parks Victoria closures:

·         Mount Buangor State Park (those who have booked for campsites have been notified by Parks Victoria)

·         Ben Major Nature Conservation Reserve (NCR) 

·         Langi-Ghiran State Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 29/02/2024 09:40 am or as the situation changes.
